name: Crane Stance
shortdesc: You enter the stance of a crane, holding your arms in an imitation of a crane’s wings.
desc: You enter the stance of a crane, holding your arms in an imitation of a crane’s wings.

name: Dragon Stance
shortdesc: You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon’s tail.
desc: You enter the stance of a dragon and make powerful leg strikes like a lashing dragon’s tail.

name: Ki Rush
shortdesc: You can use ki to move with extraordinary speed and make yourself harder to hit.
desc: You can use ki to move with extraordinary speed and make yourself harder to hit. You gain the ki rush ki spell and a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. The rules for ki spells are summarized in the sidebar on page 157, and the full rules for focus spells appear on page 300.

name: Ki Strike
shortdesc: Your study of the flow of mystical energy allows you to harness it into your physical strikes.
desc: Your study of the flow of mystical energy allows you to harness it into your physical strikes. You gain the ki strike ki spell and a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. The rules for ki spells are summarized in the sidebar on page 157, and the full rules for focus spells appear on page 300.

name: Monastic Weaponry
shortdesc: You have trained with the traditional weaponry of your monastery or school.
desc:
You have trained with the traditional weaponry of your monastery or school. You gain access to uncommon weapons that have the monk trait and become trained in simple and martial monk weapons. When your proficiency rank for unarmed attacks increases to expert or master, your proficiency rank for these weapons increases to expert or master as well.

You can use melee monk weapons with any of your monk feats or monk abilities that normally require unarmed attacks, though not if the feat or ability requires you to use a single specific type of attack, such as Crane Stance.
hint: You can use melee monk weapons with any of your monk feats or monk abilities that normally require unarmed attacks, though not if the feat or ability requires you to use a single specific type of attack, such as Crane Stance.

name: Mountain Stance
shortdesc: You enter the stance of an implacable mountain allowing you to strike with the weight of an avalanche.

name: Rain of Embers Stance
shortdesc: You enter the stance of an enraged phoenix.

name: Tiger Stance
shortdesc: You enter the stance of a tiger and can make tiger claw attacks.

name: Wolf Stance
shortdesc: You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fanged teeth.

name: Brawling Focus
shortdesc: You know how to make the most of your attacks when fighting hand-to-hand.

name: Crushing Grab
shortdesc: Like a powerful constrictor, you crush targets in your unyielding grasp.

name: Dancing Leaf
shortdesc: You are as light as a leaf whirling in the breeze.

name: Elemental Fist
shortdesc: You call upon the power of the elements, infusing your ki with elemental energy and allowing your attacks to deal energy damage.

name: Co
shortdesc: The focused power of your flurry threatens to overwhelm your opponent.
desc: The focused power of your flurry threatens to overwhelm your opponent. When you target the same creature with two Strikes from your Flurry of Blows, you can try to stun the creature. If either Strike hits and deals damage, the target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1 (or stunned 3 on a critical failure). This is an incapacitation effect.

If either Strike hits and deals damage, the target must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or be stunned 1 (or stunned 3 on a critical failure). This is an incapacitation effect.

name: Deflect Arrows
shortdesc: Your reflexes allow you to deflect ranged attacks.

name: Flurry of Maneuvers
shortdesc: Your flurry is a combination of maneuvers.
desc: Your flurry is a combination of maneuvers. You can replace one or both of your attacks during a Flurry of Blows with Grapples, Shoves, or Trips.
hint: Your can replace one or both of your attacks during a Flurry of Blows with Grapples, Shoves, or Trips.

name: Flying Kick
shortdesc: You launch yourself at a foe.

name: Guarded Movement
shortdesc: Your guard is up, even while moving.

name: Sacred Ki
shortdesc: The power of your faith suffuses your ki

name: Stand Still
shortdesc: You strike out when your foe tries to flee.

name: Wholeness of Body
shortdesc: You can restore your health by tapping into your ki.

name: Abundant Step
shortdesc: You can teleport yourself a short distance.

name: Crane Flutter
shortdesc: You interpose your arm between yourself and your opponent.

name: Dragon Roar
shortdesc: You bellow, instilling fear in your enemies.

name: Ki Blast
shortdesc: You can unleash an impactful cone of force by channeling your ki.

name: Mountain Stronghold
shortdesc: You focus on your connection to the earth and call upon the mountain to block attacks against you.

name: Tiger Slash
shortdesc: You make a fierce swipe with both hands.

name: Water Step
shortdesc: You can Stride across liquid and surfaces that don’t support your weight.

name: Whirling Throw
shortdesc: You propel your grabbed or restrained foe a great distance.
desc:
You propel your grabbed or restrained foe a great distance. You can throw the creature any distance up to 10 feet, plus 5 feet × your Strength modifier. If you successfully throw the creature, it takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier plus 1d6 per 10 feet you threw it.

Attempt an Athletics check against the foe’s Fortitude DC. You take a –2 circumstance penalty to your check if the target is one size larger than you and a –4 circumstance penalty if it’s larger than that. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check if the target is one size smaller than you and a +4 circumstance bonus if it’s smaller than that.

name: Wolf Drag
shortdesc: You rip your enemy off their feet.

name: Arrow Snatching
shortdesc: You pluck missiles from the air and hurl them back at their source.

name: Ironblood Stance
shortdesc: You enter the stance of impenetrable iron, refusing to yield to any blow.

name: Mixed Maneuver
shortdesc: You combine two different maneuvers together into a single flowing whole.

name: Tangled Forest Stance
shortdesc: You extend your arms like gnarled branches to interfere with your foes’ movements.

name: Wall Run
shortdesc: You defy gravity, traversing vertical planes as easily as the ground.

name: Sleeper Hold

name: Wind Jump
shortdesc: You gather the wind beneath you, allowing you to soar as you jump.

name: Winding Flow
shortdesc: Any journey consists of more than simply reaching your destination.

name: Diamond Soul
shortdesc: You have fortified your body and mind against eldritch effects.

name: Disrupt Ki

name: Tangled Forest Rake

name: Wild Winds Gust

name: Diamond Fists

name: Enduring Quickness

name: Fuse Stance

name: Golden Body

name: Impossible Technique
shortdesc: You execute a maneuver that defies possibility.
